data.current_summary: Detach a blog from a multi-language group
data.current_description: Detach a blog from a multi-language group.
data.description_suggestion: Removes a blog from its current multi-language group, converting it to a standalone blog. The blog will no longer be synchronized with other language variants in the group. Requires the blog ID in the request body. Returns the updated blog object with multi-language group associations removed. This operation cannot be undone without re-attaching the blog to a language group.
data.reasoning: The current description is minimal and lacks critical details for AI agent decision-making. Added: (1) explanation of what detachment means operationally, (2) input requirements (blog ID in request body), (3) output details (returns updated blog object), (4) side effects (loss of synchronization, standalone status), and (5) reversibility information to help agents understand the consequences of this action.

data.current_summary: Attach a blog to a multi-language group
data.current_description: Attach a blog to a multi-language group.
data.description_suggestion: Adds a blog to a multi-language group, enabling synchronization with other language variants. The request body must specify the blog ID, target language group ID, and language code. Returns the updated blog object with multi-language group associations established. Once attached, the blog becomes part of the language group and will be linked with other variants for coordinated management.
data.reasoning: The current description is too minimal and lacks essential information for AI agents. Added: (1) explanation of attachment purpose and effects, (2) specific input requirements from AttachToLangPrimaryRequestVNext schema (blog ID, language group ID, language code), (3) output details (returns updated blog object), and (4) side effects (blog becomes part of group, linked with variants). This enables agents to understand when and how to use this operation.
